graph

Interface Agent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinOpAgent, DecAgent, IncAgent, MulAgent, ParallelAgent, PlusAgent, SubtractAgent

    public interface Agent
    Functional building-block of the reactive graph.

    An Agent subscribes to one or more Topics, receives messages through callback(String, Message), performs a computation and usually publishes the result to another topic. Implementations can be pure functions (stateless) or maintain internal state.

    Life-cycle

    1. reset() – called when a run is (re)started; clear internal state.
    2. callback(String, Message) – invoked by the framework whenever a subscribed topic publishes a message.
    3. close() – free resources (e.g. threads, files) before program exit.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void callback(java.lang.String topic, Message msg)
      Called when one of the topics this agent subscribes to publishes a message.
      void close()
      Release resources and unsubscribe.
      default java.lang.String getEquation()
      Optional: a short textual representation of the computation this agent performs; used by HtmlGraphWriter when rendering the graph.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Identifier used in logs, debug UIs, etc.
      void reset()
      Reset internal state so the agent can be reused in another run.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Identifier used in logs, debug UIs, etc.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset internal state so the agent can be reused in another run.

      • callback

        void callback(java.lang.String topic,
              Message msg)
        Called when one of the topics this agent subscribes to publishes a message.
        Parameters:
        topic - topic name that triggered the callback
        msg - the message

      • close

        void close()
        Release resources and unsubscribe. Called once before program shutdown.

      • getEquation

        default java.lang.String getEquation()
        Optional: a short textual representation of the computation this agent performs; used by HtmlGraphWriter when rendering the graph.
